title: Canonical build rules (strict)
gaps: No evidence in AS-IS/SNIPPETS of a completed `as_is_scan.md` run or that `requirements_status.md` was populated with evidence links.
No evidence in AS-IS/SNIPPETS of `implemented_not_documented.md` being generated/maintained per §1.3/§1.7 references.
notes: AS-IS only states a scan summary exists, but does not provide file:line evidence of the mandated artifacts being generated/updated as part of a strict process.

title: Definition of Done (DoD) (strict by default)
gaps: No evidence in AS-IS/SNIPPETS of end-to-end DoD mapping per capability (UI→API→DB→side effects).
No evidence of automated tests + CI pass artifacts for happy/negative paths.
No evidence of staging deployment, smoke tests, observability signals, or operational runbooks.
notes: Only a list of some UI pages is provided; no routes/DB columns/migrations/tests/workflows were evidenced in the AS-IS summary.

title: Required build artifacts (must be produced by agentic AI)
gaps: No evidence (file:path @ line) that `as_is_scan.md`, `requirements_status.md`, `progress_report.md`, and `implemented_not_documented.md` exist in the repo and are being generated/maintained.
No evidence of the stated evidence gates being enforced (e.g., implemented requires routes + DB migrations/queries; tested requires tests + CI proof).
notes: The prompt includes an AS-IS scan summary, but it is not evidence of the required artifacts existing in-repo with deterministic outputs.

title: Production readiness gates (GO / NO-GO) (hard gates)
gaps: No evidence of a deterministic gate evaluator script (e.g., `scripts/go-no-go-gates.js`).
No evidence of CI producing/reading `out/k6.json`, `out/chaos.json`, `out/dlq.json` and emitting `out/go-no-go.md`.
No evidence of the minimum hard gates (k6 thresholds, double assignment=0, invalid queue states=0, recovery ≤5s after chaos, DLQ replay ≥70%).
notes: No CI workflows or scripts were cited in AS-IS/SNIPPETS.

title: Safe deployment automation (canary + rollback) (mandatory)
gaps: No evidence of canary automation (25%→50%→100%).
No evidence of automatic rollback triggered by GO/NO-GO gate failures.
No evidence of release tagging, runtime config snapshotting, or storing the GO/NO-GO report artifact in CI.
notes: AS-IS provides no deployment automation/workflow evidence.
